meanings.definition: Relating to the study of the physical features of the earth's surface.
meanings.sent1: The scientist conducted a geomorphological survey of the mountain range.
meanings.sent2: Her geomorphological research focused on how rivers shape landscapes.
meanings.sent3: The geomorphological puzzle was finally solved by the curious explorer.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush strokes created a geomorphological masterpiece on canvas.
meanings.sent5: The geomorphological patterns in the sand dunes fascinated the young geologist.

meanings.definition: Involving the processes that shape the landforms of the earth.
meanings.sent1: The geomorphological changes caused by erosion were evident in the canyon.
meanings.sent2: The geologist explained the geomorphological forces behind the formation of valleys.
meanings.sent3: The geomorphological dance of tectonic plates amused the science class.
meanings.sent4: The city skyline at night had a geomorphological beauty all its own.
meanings.sent5: The storm's impact on the coastline was a geomorphological spectacle to behold.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the scientific analysis of the topography and landforms.
meanings.sent1: The geomorphological study revealed the ancient history of the region.
meanings.sent2: Researchers used geomorphological data to map out the terrain accurately.
meanings.sent3: The geomorphological investigation turned into a thrilling adventure for the team.
meanings.sent4: The city planner's geomorphological approach transformed the urban landscape.
meanings.sent5: The geomorphological report highlighted the impact of glaciers on the valley.
